column1: @USDA just announced they will accept Coronavirus Food Assistance Program (CFAP-2) applications from September 21 through December 11 2020. Learn more at https://t.co/SPfrXNFLeh https://t.co/OOzGwQrxCK

Operation Warp Speed is the federal government and the private sector’s historic cooperation and effort to develop 300 million doses of a safe effective COVID-19 vaccine by January 2021. https://t.co/L8KlwSupPr

Stopped by Napoleon to discuss infrastructure the ongoing response to COVID-19 and schools being back in session. I also talked about my letter of support for @USACEHQ funding for the city’s sewer project. https://t.co/e9SvntlrqF
Read the entire report from Republican Whip @SteveScalise and the Select Subcommittee on the Coronavirus Crisis @SelectGOP here: https://t.co/8K3VBbFnqo

Wrapping up the day in central North Dakota with a visit in Carrington with local leaders. On the agenda:  👨‍🚒👩‍⚕️ The importance of essential and frontline workers  🌾 An update on crops 🦠 The ongoing response to COVID-19 https://t.co/MfdnBryD3s

📍 Turtle Lake North Dakota 📋 Importance of the post office to rural communities & the school district’s response to COVID-19 🚻 City leaders and Turtle Lake-Mercer school district officials https://t.co/DF5cvKbjBc

Thank you to @GrandForksCity Mayor Brandon Bochenski for meeting with me this morning to discuss the CARES Act the city’s ongoing response to COVID-19 and @UofNorthDakota’s fall semester beginning. https://t.co/utUoFxc2aD
If you have recovered from COVID-19 please consider donating plasma to support this treatment for current patients with the virus. https://t.co/e3Xr2mi6jb
In Stanley to meet with city and county officials. On the agenda:  🚚🛣 Highway transportation bill 🏗 🚧 Infrastructure for rural communities 🩺🦠COVID-19 response https://t.co/XMQ2v6RTqX

Held a Coffee with Kelly and gave an update to Williston city and county leaders on my work to support the state & local response to #COVID19 and my efforts to educate my colleagues about how ND communities like Williston feed and fuel the world. Thank you to all who made it out! https://t.co/rhpFIPVSMO

Spoke to Beach Mayor Henry Gerving and Sentinel Butte Mayor Jason Lee this morning about the federal state & local response to #COVID19 rural development grants the beef & pork industry supply chain and more. https://t.co/HDBPSPrq8P

Local journalists spend days and nights researching and writing about the issues our state faces. Be it DAPL our state economy or the COVID-19 situation in our region.  It was great to meet with @FORUMCOMCO’s editorial board to talk about those issues. https://t.co/CvgyohBzuP

We need answers. This isn’t a complicated reality: China suppressed information about COVID-19 for weeks and @WHO at the behest of China suppressed Taiwanese warnings that contradicted the Chinese Communist Party. https://t.co/rsfl9fdYgo
And jamming a $3000000000000 relief bill with non-COVID related legislation isn’t a diversion?  Let’s call a spade a spade. https://t.co/pWRIEF8ibZ
Today’s decision is much-needed good news for North Dakota’s oil producers as they battle the COVID—19 pandemic and the global oil price war.

.@politico @playbookplus this morning called out @SpeakerPelosi's partisanship as we try to work on the next coronavirus bill: "Neither [Pelosi’s] bill nor anything resembling it will ever become law—it's a Democratic wish list filled up with all the party’s favored policies."

Democrats’ COVID19 Oversight Committee is Impeachment 2.0—we can’t afford that during a crisis.  I have confidence in @GOPLeader ‘s  appointments of @SteveScalise @Jim_Jordan @RepWalorski @RepBlaine I’m especially glad there’s at least one doctor @repmarkgreen on the committee.
A reminder that @realDonaldTrump postponed Tax Day to July 15th so we all have less stress during this fight against COVID-19  #InThisTogetherND https://t.co/QdqEjM7Fbv
I'm calling into Brad Schmidt's show on @1310KNOX at 4:30 CT to discuss Congress's response to COVID-19.

🚨I joined Josh Meny this morning on Good Day Dakota to discuss the CARES Act the #PaycheckProtectionProgram and other ways Congress is helping North Dakotans during the COVID-19 pandemic. If you need help with the programs we’ve put in place please call my office https://t.co/76stOM1j0G

The CARES Act provided $200 million in funding for the COVID-19 Telehealth Program and applications for its benefits are now open. Qualifying providers will receive full funding of their vital Telehealth services. For how to apply please see below.  https://t.co/HhwYy8TxV1

This is an encouraging report. Foreign manipulation of oil prices in addition to the effects of COVID-19 are threatening America’s energy security. Our energy dominance is a major driver of jobs and strengthens America's national security. #NDoil https://t.co/Ff9lYSQg1c

I’ve been heartened by North Dakotans helping North Dakotans while we battle COVID-19. @HouseGOP just launched a website to highlight and salute these great Americans. We all can find inspiration in how our communities have responded to this challenge. https://t.co/mqMYuj0VPL https://t.co/QsaEGovwgN

On this #WorldHealthDay I thank the public health officials in ND and throughout the country who are working to stop the COVID-19 pandemic. From the medical professionals in emergency rooms and ICUs to the researchers working around the clock to develop a vaccine we thank you. https://t.co/Tt1CXkVAFD
Tune in to @theflagwzfg tonight at 7 PM CT as I discuss the latest coronavirus developments with @SteveHallstrom. You can listen live online here: https://t.co/zt6Cm1HVXl

Good news: @ENERGY opened up 30M barrels of storage in the Strategic Petroleum Reserve for US oil producers that are struggling due to the effects of COVID-19 and the intentional disruption of world oil markets by foreign actors. #NDoil https://t.co/kF6kHMC4mf
Social Security recipients who do not typically file a tax return do NOT need to file one in order to receive the one-time coronavirus tax rebate. Learn more here: https://t.co/SL4IADYF5D

ND now has 142 confirmed cases of COVID-19. If everyone does their part in staying home and following proper physical distancing when doing essential activities like grocery shopping we can flatten the curve in our state and save lives. https://t.co/tkW3z4jHf5 https://t.co/DZv47I1oMF
I spoke to @robport minutes after the House sent the Phase 3 coronavirus relief bill to President Trump's desk. Check out our conversation: https://t.co/lPetsZypji

My deepest sympathies to the family. Gov. Burgum is right - each loss of life ripples across families and communities. Let us each recommit to stopping the spread of coronavirus to help save lives. https://t.co/trfxiblkH9

Looking for updates on what Congress has done and is doing to respond to the coronavirus? Check out the Coronavirus Updates page on my website which includes info on Phase I II & III legislation and @CDCgov guidelines and resources. https://t.co/kIO8Yf3ouF

The Phase III coronavirus relief package provides resources to combat COVID-19 & provide financial stability to Americans and U.S. businesses. Here’s a detailed breakdown of what it means for individuals families small businesses & healthcare providers https://t.co/PRghR2mvJH
I'm joining @JayThomasAM970 on WDAY Radio at the top of the hour to talk about my thoughts on the Senate coronavirus legislation. Listen live online: https://t.co/LzGaw0JiFl

Speaker Pelosi's coronavirus bill is an ideological wish list and has very little to do with helping our country stop this pandemic.   It's time to put the American people first. No more political games. https://t.co/NpXaZ21g7k

I'm calling in to @1310KNOX at the top of the hour to discuss the latest on the federal and North Dakota response to the coronavirus. Call in with your questions and listen live online at https://t.co/zl0CFjzEQe

Small businesses: You may be eligible for up to $2 million in @SBAgov low-interest loans if your business has been affected by the coronavirus. These loans can help fill your working capital needs. Non-profits may also be eligible. Apply online here: https://t.co/lgy3mRb5eG

This FAQ from @WaysandMeansGOP has accurate verified information on the federal response to the coronavirus. It covers what small businesses seniors and workers need to know. Please read and share to spread the word! https://t.co/34aDmq60Hr

If we all take part in social distancing such as avoiding large groups and staying home if feeling sick we can "flatten the curve" on the coronavirus and more quickly overcome this public health emergency. Learn more at https://t.co/CPdmL6IYLO. https://t.co/a8Vypoe1cm

I joined @JoelKFGO this morning to talk about the U.S. and North Dakota response to the coronavirus and the effect of the Saudi and Russian oil production boost on North American producers. Listen to the podcast here:  https://t.co/A51Pvn9cbe https://t.co/0rF8aCFgGI
Important information on the situation with coronavirus in North Dakota from @DougBurgum and state officials ⤵️ https://t.co/4668IpjOuJ
.@DougBurgum is speaking now regarding the coronavirus in North Dakota: https://t.co/Q1HjU7PMMq
Tune in to @chrisbergPOVNOW tonight to catch our conversation on #coronavirus #NDoil and #FISA reforms. #NDpol https://t.co/T4WcaXhMkA

The symptoms of coronavirus include fever cough & shortness of breath. If you develop symptoms & have been in close contact with someone who with coronavirus or if you have recently traveled to an affected area @CDCgov recommends you call a doctor. https://t.co/FXHk89gBcQ
I'm joining @scotthennen on @theflagwzfg & @KFYR550 at 10:35 to discuss the latest with the coronavirus and take your questions. Tune in! https://t.co/zt6Cm1ZxlV

I’m glad this bill passed with strong bipartisan support. It provides important funding for federal state & local gov'ts to respond to the coronavirus. I’ll continue to work with my colleagues to ensure health officials have all the resources they need. https://t.co/r80s4vstcY

We have the best team in the world to protect [Americans] from COVID-19 and the best public health and health care systems to rely on. We should be cautious and take appropriate measures to prepare and protect ourselves but we should not be afraid. https://t.co/DnkPKnLhbL

.@CDCgov along with @NDDOH are actively monitoring and responding to the coronavirus (COVID-19). For up-to-date information on the U.S. response nationwide please bookmark and share the CDC's main website for COVID-19 updates: https://t.co/rQl1XXmyxR

North Dakota health officials updated my office today on the state's response to COVID-19 (coronavirus). Please see the video update below and bookmark this website to make sure you're up to date with the latest most accurate information: https://t.co/UClV1OzwUl https://t.co/jOCmoWEbOJ
